overview_of_class: Improvisation is both a creative tool/process that informs dance composition and as a stand-alone dance form. This class introduces students to improvisation as a practice and a performance form, with emphasis placed on practice. Class time is treated as a movement laboratory for experiential learning. Students will work alone as well as in duets, trios and larger groups. In addition to physical practice, in-class discussion/observation and reflection is a central component of the class. Texts that introduce the history and philosophy of improvisation in dance (or other forms) will be assigned, as well as journaling and other out of class assignments
